Definition: an adjective that refers to something that is first in time, original, or existing from the very beginning
relating to an element of culture or system of behavior that is passed from one individual to another by imitation or other nongenetic means
an adjective used to describe something that is misleading, erroneous, or based on a fallacy. An argument or reasoning that is logically unsound or incorrect
of or relating to knowledge or the conditions for acquiring it. It encompasses various aspects of knowledge, including how it is formed, justified, and validated
a sinner who is not of the elect and is predestined to damnation, also an unprincipled person (often used humorously or affectionately)
